intro: Echioglossum chantaburiense, commonly known as the Thai bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Thailand. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to purple. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the summer. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
